title: If Keen were in Warcraft iii...
content:
So I got bored, and just considered this for a long time. What if someone made a Warcraft iii mod with characters from the Keen universe? Anyone play that game? I ended up coming up with ideas of units/buildings of several armies, including the Vorticons and Shikadi. See what you think of this.

Heroes

Commander Keen
Defender of the Universe
Starting Health: 500-600
Ending Healh: 800-900
Starting Mana: 300
Ending Mana: 500
Damage: 40-50
Weapons: Neural stunner
Attacks: Land and air units

Comments: Quick and agile, Commander Keen is an able leader of any army into battle.

Abilities:
Pogo - turns the Commander into an air unit for two of every three seconds, stunning a random nearby enemy unit and dealing light damage whenever landing near enemy troops.

Uses mana until deactivated.
Upgrades: Reduce mana usage, increase damage, increase stun time.
Starting stats: About 10 mana/second, 10 damage, 2 second stun
Ending stats: About 3 mana/second, 25 damage, 5 second stun

Flower power - Attacks a unit, turning it into a flower.
Upgrades: Reduce reload delay, increase stunning time.
Stats - 75 mana usage
Starting stats: About 20 second reload delay, 15 second stun
Ending stats: About 5 second reload delay, 25 second stun

Intelligent Optimization (autocasting) - Increases the speed of nearby friendly units
Upgrades: Increase speed.

Ankh Power - Renders the Commander invincible for thirty seconds
Stats - 100-140 mana usage

(Resurrection?)

---


Vorticons

*All Vorticon lose their jumping capabilities at night*

Capabilities
Jump
Damage: Gives the Vorticon a 40% probability to deal 2x damage, and a 10% probability to deal 3x damage. Upon landing, the Vorticon deals 10 damage to nearby enemy units.
Comments: Briefly turns the Vorticon into an air unit. Each jump lasts the time it takes to complete a normal attack
Stats: Initially 10-15 second reload, can be upgraded downward to 5-8

High Jump
Damage: Gives the Vorticon a 50% probability to deal 3x damage, and a 15% probability to deal 4x damage. Upon landing, the Vorticon deals 20 damage to nearby enemy units.
Comments: Briefly turns the Vorticon into an air unit. Each jump lasts about 1.5x the time it takes to complete a normal attack
Stats: Initially 10-15 second reload, can be upgraded downward to 5-8

Foot soldiers
Vorticon Grunt
Health: 250-350
Damage: 20-30
Attacks: Land units
Capabilities: Jump

Ranged soldiers
Vorticon Warrior Elite
Health: 300-450
Damage: 30-40
Weapons: Vorticon Hyperpistol
Attacks: Land and air units
Capabilities: Jump

Large attackers
Vorticon Mothers
Health: 600-700
Damage: 30-40
Weapons: Fire Breath
Attacks: Land and air units

Vortininjas
Health: Approx 500
Damage: 40-50
Attacks: Land units
Capabilities: High jump

Mechanical
Vorticon Butler Robot
Health: Approx 600
Damage: 20-30 (more on buildings)
Attacks: Land units
Comments: Fires in bursts with long reload delay

Sea Transports
Loch Mess Monster
Health: 1000-1500
Damage: 40-50
Attacks: Land and air units
Capacity: 6
Comments: Light unit with attacking capacity

Buildings

Altar of (?)
Resurrects Heroes


---

Heroes

Mortimer McMire
Grand Intellect
Starting Health: 600-700
Ending Healh: 900-1000
Starting Mana: 400
Ending Mana: 700
Damage: 50-70
Weapons: ???
Attacks: Land units

Comments: Slower and more damage-oriented than Commander Keen, the Grand Intellect has always preferred the darker powers to put his plans into action.

Abilities:
Project Decoy - This is one of the ways the Grand Intellect manages to consistently survive so long.
Stats: 50-60 mana usage
Upgrades: Increases number of decoys, lifetime
Starting stats: One decoy, 30 seconds
Endin stats: Two decoys, sixty seconds.
(I swear there's something better than this, but I can't think of anything at the moment)

Summon Shikadi Overlord - Summons an enhanced Shikadi Master.
Stats: 100-110 mana usage
Upgrades: Increase lifetime
Starting stats: Lasts about twenty seconds
Ending stats: Last about sixty seconds.

Dark Caricature (autocasting) - Decreases the speed of nearby enemy units through his intimidation and dark aura
Upgrades: Increases range, slightly increases slowness

Mangling Machine - Encases the Grand Intellect in a lighter version of this technological terror for one minute, or until the machine is destroyed. Although slower, this mechanical unit is heavily armored and simultaneously emits sonic attacks from Meeps.
Stats: 150 mana usage
Health: 300
Attacks: Land units
Additional attacks: Multi-directional sonic blasts from meeps, attacks air units

---

Shikadi Army

*Note, all Shikadi "hiding" capabilities vanish in sunlight*

Foot soldiers
Shikadi
Health: 350-450
Damage: 25-40
Attacks: Land units, can attack air units if "create energy pole" skill is learned
Capabilities: Hide
Comments: Slightly more costly

Ranged soldiers
Shockstund
Health: 200-250
Damage: 20-30
Capabilities: Hide
Attacks: Land, air units

Large attackers
Shikadi Master
Health: 500-650
Damage: 30-45
Weapons: Electrospheres (also sprays energy in random directions to do damage around it)
Attacks: Land and air units
Capabilities: Teleport, Hide
Comments: The Shikadi Master is lazy, in some sense: it rarely walks, preferring to constantly use its teleport, even only to move relatively short distances.

Mechanical

Robo Red
Health: 800-900
Damage: 20-30 (does slightly more damage on buildings)
Weapons: Laser "machine gun"
Attacks: Land and air units
Comments: Fires in long eratic bursts, about half the shots miss
Disadvantages: Blind, infers everything around it by sound (represented by very short range vision), slow.

Shikadi Mine
Health: 100-250
Damage: 100-150 in small radius around it, with a few spraying shards doing 20-30 more damage each
Attacks: Buildings only
Disadvantages: Slow, has relatively short range vision
Comments: Explodes when destroyed

Air Units
Volte-Face
Health: 100-200
Damage: 10-15
Attacks: Land and air units

Buildings

*Note: All buildings transform area around it into "energetic landscape"*

Energetic Landscape
Comments: Similar to "blight" for Undead. Indicates the plane of the world is in rapport with Shikadi energy. Shikadi can only erect energy buildings on this land. They recharge health and mana more quickly here. Does slight damage (1-2/sec) on enemy units. Visible as land with slight Shikadi aura.

(Shikadi Gateway?)
Health: 1000-2000
Comments: Main Shikadi building, acts as a hub for powering "energetic landscape"

Altar of Energy (?)
Resurrects Heroes

Damage: N/A

Learned Ability: Swim
Hero can learn to swim and attack underwater.

Hero:
Shikadi Master
Scourge of the Universe
Starting Health: 800 - 900
Ending Health: 1000 - 1100
Starting Mana: 150
Ending Mana: 300
Damage: 60-80
Weapons: Electric blast
Attacks: Land and air units

Abilities:

Massive shock
Shikadi charges energy for a few seconds before expelling a gigantic area shock wave of energy. Does 150 - 400 damage. Effects land, air, and sea units. Uses 250 Manna.

Invulnerability
Makes hero invulnerable to all attacks for a limited amount of time.

(That's all I can think of for abilities. Anyone else?)

Can detect invisible creatures and see long distances.

title: *ponders*
content:
Starcraft would be much more suitable for this kind of thing. However, you'd still be trapped by each race's building styles and such. Then again, we seem to be able to make some incredible stuff within the limits of even the Keen engine, so anything's possible...

Then again... to what degree can WCIII be modded? If a race can be rebuilt from scratch, then it could be more viable.

It would be interesting to see the BWB or Keen as a hero unit. Ooh, and let's not forget the ships the bips operate. Cave assectatorem Ductoris Alacris
